meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be audited.
meanings.sent1: The auditability of the financial records ensured transparency in the company's operations.
meanings.sent2: The company's auditability made it easy for the external auditors to review their financial statements.
meanings.sent3: The auditability of the system was so clear that even a child could understand it.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty had an auditability that shone through even the most complex financial reports.
meanings.sent5: The auditability of the documents was like a bright light illuminating any discrepancies.

meanings.definition: The ability to undergo an audit.
meanings.sent1: The company's auditability was crucial for meeting regulatory requirements.
meanings.sent2: The auditability of the system allowed for a smooth and efficient audit process.
meanings.sent3: His auditability was put to the test when the auditors arrived unannounced.
meanings.sent4: The auditability of the software was like a sturdy bridge supporting the audit procedures.
meanings.sent5: The auditability of the records was as reliable as a compass guiding the audit team.

meanings.definition: The capability of being examined for accuracy or compliance.
meanings.sent1: The auditability of the data was essential for ensuring data integrity.
meanings.sent2: The auditability of the process allowed for a thorough review of compliance measures.
meanings.sent3: The auditability of the report was so clear that it left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent4: Her auditability in following procedures was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The auditability of the system was like a magnifying glass revealing any inconsistencies.
